newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian lira falls to 3-month low at 1,000/mark.
newsitem.headline: Italian lira falls to 3-month low at 1,000/mark.

text.p: The Italian lira fell to its lowest level against the mark for three months, touching the psychological 1,000 per mark barrier despite reported intervention by the Bank of Italy, dealers said.
The lira was quoted at 999.90/0.20 per mark by 1547 GMT having touched a session low at 1,000.30.
The last time it was this weak was on November 22, 1996, shortly before it re-entered Europe's exchange rate mechanism with a central parity against the mark of 990.
